sect1.title: Secure boot
sect1.para: For the secure boot functionality to work on a &zseries; system, the following conditions must be met.

listitem.para: The machine must be z15 T01, z15 T02, LinuxONE III LT1, LinuxONE III LT2, or a later model.
You must use an LPAR (secure boot is not supported on z/VM and &kvm;).
The LPAR must have secure boot enabled.
You must use SCSI (FCP) disks (secure boot is not supported on DASD).

note.title: Hardware migration
note.para: In case you migrate to a different machine (for example, from z13 to z15), ensure that the LPAR on the target machine has the secure boot state of the system on its disk.

sect1.para: Changing the secure boot state must be performed according to the following procedure.

step.para: Enable secure boot in &yast; and write the new boot loader.
Change the configuration of the LPAR (enable or disable secure boot).

note.title: Secure boot on HMC
note.para: The system on the disk configured with the secure=1 parameter can be booted on z15 HMC as long as the firmware supports the new on-disk format (which is always the case on z15).
